TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MenuBindingsEditor extends System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor

Docs.summary: Provides a component editor for the collection of the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuBindingsEditor> class provides a user interface for editing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemBinding> elements of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.DataBindings%2A> collection within the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuBindingsEditor> object is invoked by selecting the ellipsis (**…**) button on the **DataBindings** property in the **Properties** grid of the visual designer, or by choosing **Edit Menu Items** from the **Common Tasks** context menu on the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuBindingsEditor.EditValue%2A> method edits the values of the data bindings collection of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuBindingsEditor.GetEditStyle%2A> method gets the editing style that is associated with this editor.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EditorAttribute> attribute to associate the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuBindingsEditor> class and the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor> class (the bindings editor base class) with a property in a custom control, derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl> class, that gets and sets a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemCollection> collection.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuEditors#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuEditors/CS/MenuEditors.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuEditors#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuEditors/VB/MenuEditors.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuBindingsEditor> class when you select the ellipsis (**…**) button on the **DataBindings** property in the **Properties** grid of the visual designer, or by choosing **Edit Menu Items** from the **Common Tasks** context menu on the control, when designing the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object EditValue (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, IServiceProvider provider, object value);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance object EditValue(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.IServiceProvider provider, object value) cil managed
Public Overrides Function EditValue (context As ITypeDescriptorContext, provider As IServiceProvider, value As Object) As Object
public: override System::Object ^ EditValue(System::ComponentModel::ITypeDescriptorContext ^ context, IServiceProvider ^ provider, System::Object ^ value);

Docs.param: An object implementing the interface that is used to acquire context information.
An object implementing the interface, through which editing services can be obtained.
The object to edit the value for.
Docs.summary: Edits the value of the data bindings collection of the associated control.
Docs.returns: The new ; otherwise, if the value of the object has not changed, unchanged.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuBindingsEditor.EditValue%2A> method extracts the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> object that is associated with that control from the `context` parameter. Then the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuBindingsEditor.EditValue%2A> method calls back on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> object to display an editing dialog box that is used to edit the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemBindingCollection> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.

block.para: The parameter is not used by this implementation of the method but is available for you to override in derived classes

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditorEditStyle GetEditStyle(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetEditStyle (context As ITypeDescriptorContext) As UITypeEditorEditStyle

Docs.param: An object implementing the interface that indicates the context of the object being edited.
Docs.summary: Gets the editing style that is associated with this editor.
Docs.returns: The editing style that is associated with this editor.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuBindingsEditor.GetEditStyle%2A> method always returns the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditorEditStyle.Modal> value, which indicates that the editor user interface (UI) is a modal dialog box.

block.para: The parameter is not used by this implementation of the method but is available for you to override in derived classes
